We should start hearing reports now as an early thaw has come to parts of Afghanistan and the Taliban is on the move early before Kabul can get out of garrison and to the thawing provinces.

The Taliban and Al Quaida/ISIS, despite their feuds, will combine to kill this many Afghanis by Q2 2018.  The American military will do in at least half so many, possibly equalling the local groups' tally, meaning even quicker achievement of the 1,000-civilians-killed threshold.  "Systematically" is a loaded term.  Each of these groups is "systematically" out to protect its interests, fully aware that casualties are inevitable and not merely "collateral damage."  To me, this defines systematic conspiracy to murder.

1) Diminished capacity of coalition forces; 2) Pakistan threatening to restrict supplies through LOCs due to loss of US aid; 3) the emergence of ISIS in Afghanistan and their signing cooperative treaty with the Taliban; 4) Recent increase in VBIED attacks in Kabul killing over 100 bystanders.
Heavily monitored. Mass civilian fatalities seems less likely in Afghanistan.

The body count is mounting up, but there are several groups competing.  Under the oddly restrictive definition of this lot of questions, this will be a No unless at least a thousand kills can be attributed to just one of the groups, intentionally targeting etcetera. Sticking to 5%. A hundred here, a hundred there and the numbers will no doubt be met, but don’t believe it qualifies as “one or more campaigns”. Daesh just not the old Daesh I remember (struggling against al Qaeda).
